channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed

item.title: Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterfly Remake Gets Spooky On Switch 2 In March
item.content:encoded:
Pre-orders opening soon

After cropping up back in the September Direct, Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterfly Remake made another haunting appearance at last night's State of Play showcase, and what do you know, it got a release date this time.

Koei Tecmo and Team Ninja have announced that the next spooky remake will arrive on Switch 2 on 12th March 2026. Pre-orders open today on PC, PS5 and Xbox Series, though Koei Tecmo states that we Switch 2 fans will have to wait until "a later date" to bagsy our copies.

As the latest trailer showcases, the remake has seen a pretty substantial upgrade in the visual and sound departments, with Minakami Village and its wraiths packing an extra level of creepy detail. There are also some new features this time, including focus, zoom and filters for your Camera Obscura, and the ability to hold Mayu's hand for a much-needed health and spirit boost.

In terms of performance, the game's official website states that the Switch 2 version will run at 1080p / 30fps, with no support for HDR. That said, there is the option to move the Camera Obscura with gyro aiming in handheld mode, so that's something.

The game will soon be available to pre-order in both its standard and 'Digital Deluxe' forms — the latter of which throws in a digital soundtrack, digital artbook and a handful of bonus costumes for Mio and Mayu.

Will you be checking this one out on Switch 2 in March? Let us know in the comments.

Jim came to Nintendo Life in 2022 and, despite his insistence that The Minish Cap is the best Zelda game and his unwavering love for the Star Wars prequels (yes, really), he has continued to write news and features on the site ever since.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/fatal-frame-2-crimson-butterfly-remake-gets-spooky-on-switch-2-in-march

item.title: Aion 2 To Launch Globally in the Second Half of 2026; Monetization To Be Less Aggressive Than Throne and Liberty
item.content:encoded:
During its Q3 2025 quarterly report (as spotted by MassivelyOP), NCSoft announced that Aion 2 will debut on the global stage in the second half of 2026. The MMORPG is set to launch in exactly a week from today in South Korea and Taiwan for PC and mobile devices.

Aion 2 is a direct sequel to the 2009 classic MMORPG. It's set roughly 200 years after the events seen in that game. Its massive game world is estimated to be around 1,200 square kilometers and features distinct biomes like dusty frontier towns, icy peaks, flowing rivers, and hidden labs. Just like in the original, flight mechanics are included both for exploration and aerial combat. Players can also look forward to eight classes, more than 200 dungeons (between the solo and group ones), various PvP modes (large-scale faction warfare between the Elyos and Asmodian, but also 1v1, 4v4, 8v8 arenas), and other systems like housing. In the investors' call, NCSoft promised that Aion 2 would feature less aggressive monetization compared to Throne and Liberty, which in turn should 'secure a bigger userbase'. As confirmed a couple of weeks ago, the game, powered by Epic's Unreal Engine 5, will support NVIDIA DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation.

2026 is poised to be a significant year for NCSoft, with the launch of Aion 2 and other key titles, including Cinder City, Limit Zero Breakers, and Time Takers. We covered Cinder City from Gamescom 2025; it's an intriguing open world third-person shooter with MMO-like elements coming in 2026 to PC and consoles. Check out our exclusive interview with the development team here.

Limit Zero Breakers, developed by VIC GAME STUDIOS, is a free-to-play anime-style cooperative action RPG due in 2026 for PC (Steam) and mobile. In the game, a team of adventurers known as 'Breakers' explores a fragmented, corrupted world from atop a powerful airship, searching for the mythical 'Library of the Gods'. During battle, players unleash stylish attacks and combinations against enormous creatures lurking in ancient dungeons, striving to restore peace to the continent of Seraphia.

As for Time Takers, it's a third-person team-based shooter for PC (Steam) and consoles that features Time Energy as a unique resource that players can spend on reviving teammates or upgrading skills, for example.

Arguably, though, the most exciting game in NCSoft's whole upcoming lineup could be the one set to be announced tomorrow at G-Star 2025. According to rumors, it might be the Horizon MMO we first heard about three years ago. Earlier this year, another rumor claimed it had been canceled, but that might have been incorrect. We'll know for sure in a few hours.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/aion-2-launch-globally-second-half-2026-monetization-less-aggressive/

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign's The Forsaken Hollows DLC drops next month, brings back a beloved Dark Souls bumkicker
item.content:encoded:
Someone's put a big hole in Limveld

Yep, Elden Ring Nightreign developers FromSoftware are definitely planning to release some DLC for the action RPG by March 2026. A DLC dubbed The Forsaken Hollows was revealed at last night's PlayStation State of Play, and is set to drop on December 4th.

The PlayStation blog about the DLC speaks of the "Great Hollow", a big hole that's opened up in the depths of Limveld, shifting the earth. It's filled with ancient ruins, life-sapping crystals, and also lots of things that want to take your lunch money.

Venturing forth as your tried and tested Nightfarer or one of the two new ones added by the DLC, you'll come face to face with bosses like Shadow of the Erdtree's Dancing Lion and Dark Souls' abyss-battling knight Artorias. Don't worry, I'm sure they won't be too tough, especially if you accept those fresh shoes and take them on as the Scholar, a nerdy Nightfarer with big book smarts, or the Undertaker, an abbess with lots of strength, faith, and presumably the ability to immediately reassure anyone she says "my condolences" to.

As for how it'll all fit in lore-wise, FromSoft had the following to say: "In our war against the Night, every battle left a scar. These wounds were given will. A foul life, born of cast-away souls. Steel your resolve, Nightfarers. This hunt must be seen to its end." There's also chatter about someone called "the Dreglord" and how they must be sliced, spelled or smacked out of existence in this tale of post-night battling. Odds are they're the weird thing which roars near the end of the trailer, with the studio being quite coy about both them and the gang of angelic fighters pictured in the new threats section of the PS blog.

I'm sure if you waltz over to your old buddy Artorias on December 4th, he'll be happy to give you the rundown.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/elden-ring-nightreigns-the-forsaken-hollows-dlc-drops-next-month-brings-back-a-beloved-dark-souls-bumkicker

item.title: Former Nintendo boss "surprised" more Xbox games aren't on Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
Believes it would "be in their best interest".

Former Nintendo of America boss Reggie Fils-Aimé is "surprised" that Xbox has "not yet fully embraced" the newly released Switch 2, as part of a discussion on third-party support.

In an interview with The Game Business, Fils-Aimé stated Nintendo will "never position itself as a direct competitor to PlayStation", though the company would "welcome some of the latest core gamer-type of content". Microsoft's Phil Spencer, meanwhile, called Nintendo a "great partner" and confirmed support for the Switch 2, though little has been announced so far.

"I'm surprised that Xbox has not yet fully embraced Switch 2 from a software perspective," said Fils-Aimé. "Certainly some games could easily be ported over to Switch 2. And I'm surprised that we haven't seen more of that. I thought there would be much more, especially during this timeframe leading into the Holiday.

"All through the fall, I was fully expecting some dedicated announcement. And I'm surprised it hasn't happened."

Fils-Aimé also noted that Nintendo, PlayStation, and Xbox are no longer directly competing, due to their differing approaches this generation. While PlayStation focuses on premium products and exclusives, and Nintendo remains focused on its hybrid console series, Xbox is moving further into publishing.

"I do think that the years of direct competition are done," said Fils-Aimé. "With a large part of the Xbox business now being publishing, by definition, they're a big third-party publisher that also makes some hardware. From that standpoint, they are no longer directly competing with the PlayStation business. And in fact, they need support from Sony for Microsoft's software to reach the largest audience. And as I said earlier, I think it would be in their best interest to find ways for Xbox software, beyond Minecraft, to make its way onto the Nintendo platform. So, from that standpoint, direct warfare is over.

"But, on the other hand, gamers out there have limited budgets. You have to win for every dollar spent; you need to win for every minute spent playing. And so there's always going to be a war going on. It may be below the surface, but there's always going to be a battle for attention and mindshare."

Last year, Xbox games Pentiment and Grounded made their way to the Switch and were set to be followed by Hi-Fi Rush, though that's reportedly shifted to Switch 2. Indiana Jones and the Great Circle is officially coming to Switch 2 next year.

Meanwhile, last month Xbox announced its long-time exclusive Halo is headed to PS5. Could Switch 2 also be on the cards?

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/former-nintendo-boss-surprised-more-xbox-games-arent-on-switch-2

item.title: Marvel Rivals Teases Deadpool & Elsa Bloodstone as Next Characters
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Rivals is gearing up for Season 5 and its first anniversary celebrations, but teases for the next two characters potentially being introduced in the game have surfaced—including Deadpool.

Season 5 is bringing X-Men duo Gambit and Rogue into the fray for Season 5, with the former available from the season start on November 14, expanding the roster of characters available to 45, and there are no signs of stopping.

NetEase has regularly teased which characters are coming soon in in-game lore, which previously teased the additions of Angela and Daredevil in Season 4, and fresh teases that may have revealed the two characters coming in Season 6.

Deadpool & Elsa Bloodstone Teases in Marvel Rivals Season 5

As spotted by RivalsAssembled on X, the Season 5 gallery card drops a major hint that Deadpool and Elsa Bloodstone are lined up as the next two characters to join the game.

On the gallery card, it teases “Earth-born operatives” that have been “working behind the scenes,” describing the pair as including a “blathering, foul-mouthed mercenary and a monster hunter as deadly as she is beautiful.”

The brief descriptions certainly fit Deadpool, widely known as the Merc with a Mouth, and, while Elsa Bloodstone isn’t as much of a mainstream name as Wade Wilson, the description accurately highlights her.

Of course, nothing is guaranteed at this stage, but Marvel Rivals developers have always been very clever with their placement of easter eggs in the game, following them up with full reveals later down the line.

The pair aren’t the only teases from Season 5, however, as the reveal trailer included a shot of Cyclops attending the wedding of Rogue and Gambit, while Professor X’s voice played over part of the video.

Which characters are you desperate to see Marvel Rivals introduce in 2026? Let us know your wishes in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Marvel Rivals, check out the news that a huge anniversary gift of $25 worth of currency will be available to players in Season 5’s celebrations.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/marvel-rivals-teases-deadpool-elsa-bloodstone-as-next-characters/

item.title: Marvel Rivals Players Will Receive $25 of Currency in Anniversary Celebrations
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Rivals is rapidly approaching its first anniversary, and NetEase has revealed that all players will receive 2500 Units later this month to celebrate.

The PvP hero shooter has come on leaps and bounds in the past year, with regular seasonal transitions introducing new characters, maps, and game modes, and Season 5 is making some major changes.

X-Men Rogue and Gambit headline the additions for Season 5, but it’s a gift from the developers that will catch the eye of most players.

Marvel Rivals Players to Get 2500 Units

In the latest Dev Vision video ahead of the start of Season 5 on November 14, Marvel Rivals director Guangguang revealed that players will receive 2500 Units, the equivalent of $25, in-game as part of the Anniversary Celebration kicking off on November 27.

The Anniversary Celebration event will also allow players to earn a free Legendary Jeff the Land Shark skin, while other Anniversary-themed costumes will be added to the game to purchase.

Season 5 in Marvel Rivals also has plenty of other big additions to the game, including a new social hub that can fit up to 100 players, the long-awaited introduction of cross-progression in the game, and placement matches being added to Ranked—something that the community has been crying out for.

Season 5 kicks off on Friday, November 14 and will last until January 2026, with a mid-season break to introduce Season 5.5 that brings Rogue to the game as the latest playable character.

Has Marvel Rivals lived up to your expectations in its first year? Let us know your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more news, check out the Nexon CEO’s defense of AI voices in Arc Raiders, and read about Ubisoft working on a new multiplayer shooter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/marvel-rivals-players-will-receive-25-of-currency-in-anniversary-celebrations/

item.title: 27″ PlayStation Gaming Monitor Announced, Will Launch Next Year in the US and Japan
item.content:encoded:
During the State of Play Japan broadcast that aired a few hours ago, Sony announced a 27-inch PlayStation Gaming Monitor that will launch next year in the United States and Japan. No pricing has been revealed yet, but we do know its specifications:

  • Quad High Definition (QHD) IPS display with a resolution of up to 2560 x 1440, allowing players to game at a comfortable viewing distance from their desk.
  • High Dynamic Range (HDR) support with Auto HDR Tone Mapping, which automatically adjusts HDR settings during setup on PS5 and PS5 Pro consoles, ensuring a rich and vivid picture quality.
  • Variable Refresh Rate (VRR) support and refresh rates of up to 120 Hz for smooth and seamless gameplay on PS5 and PS5 Pro consoles, and 240 Hz on compatible PC and Mac devices.
  • Built-in Charging Hook for a DualSense or DualSense Edge wireless controller (sold separately), making it easy for players to get right into gaming.

The PlayStation Gaming Monitor is equipped with two 2.1 HDMI IN ports and one 1.4 DisplayPort IN port for compatibility with PlayStation 5, PC, Mac, or other devices. The 2.1 HDMI IN ports support up to 2560×1440 resolution, 240Hz frame rate, Fixed Rate Link (FRL), and VRR; the 1.4 DisplayPort IN port supports up to 2560×1440 resolution, 240Hz frame rate, and Display Stream Compression (DSC).

You'll also find two USB Type-A and one USB Type-C port that can be used with PlayStation Link Adapters or other devices. The display is compatible with select VESA mounting systems to mount it on a wall, for instance. When it comes to audio, there's a built-in stereo speaker and 3.5mm audio output, but Sony recommends pairing it with the upcoming Pulse Elevate Wireless Speakers. This set features planar magnetic drivers and a built-in microphone, and it's also due to launch in 2026.

Spec-wise, the PlayStation Gaming Monitor is undoubtedly a step down from Sony's Inzone M10S OLED and M9 II monitors released last year. However, it's also likely to be significantly more affordable, although we'll have to wait for official pricing news to know exactly how much it will cost.

During the aforementioned State of Play, Sony also announced a new, cheaper Japan-only version of the PlayStation 5. Publisher Bandai Namco also unveiled a DLC for Elden Ring: Nightreign.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.



https://wccftech.com/27-inch-playstation-gaming-monitor-announced-will-launch-next-year/

item.title: Love Them or Hate Them, Extraction Shooters Are Running Wild Right Now
item.content:encoded:
The extraction genre is having a defining moment. From the gritty realism of Escape from Tarkov to the retro-futuristic chaos of ARC Raiders, gamers are flocking to these more challenging-than-most titles that fuse looting, survival, and high-stakes choice-and-consequence gameplay loops.

Even satirical titles like Escape from Duckov, packed with absurd mechanics and visuals, are finding solid audiences and millions of sales. But why? Because extraction shooters tap into something deeper than just gameplay: they simulate risk and tension in a way that no other genre can.

At their core, extraction shooters are typically built around loss aversion and delayed gratification concepts. Every raid is a gamble, every crate or box opened is like spinning a slot machine, and finishing up an intense, high-value run releases an immense burst of dopamine-fuelled satisfaction that’s almost unmatched in gaming.

Players entire deeply hostile zones in extraction shooters, and set about completing quests, gathering loot, and fighting enemies both human and AI-driven. The kicker is that they must extract to keep their loot, and a single misstep can lead to crumbling fortunes.

Every decision – engage or evade, loot or leave – is loaded with consequence and consideration. This mirrors real-world psychological triggers, and it gets those synapses firing.

  • Loss Aversion, otherwise known in the extraction space as ‘Gear Fear’, gives you a sense of acute ownership over the loot you collect, and the thought of losing it again increases anxiety
  • Variable Rewards, which tie into the gambling mechanic, mean that you never know what you’ll find in a room or a box, which makes you want to keep opening more, especially when you get a rare item
  • Mastery and Progression, the mechanics of which encourage players to learn the best loot routes, methods, combat metas, and more, in a bid to become as wealthy or powerful as possible

This sublime cocktail of tension, reward, and trepidation creates a psychological loop that’s more potent than traditional run-and-gun multiplayer shooters.

Why is ARC Raiders Different?

ARC Raiders is the number one extraction shooter on the market right now, and it has achieved millions of sales and record-high scores for the genre. It’ll be challenged by Escape from Tarkov’s 1.0 release, set to drop on November 15, but for now, it’s doing just fine.

Embark Studios poured a little something special into the extraction shooter formula in ARC Raiders, and it has proven to be a huge success. In ARC Raiders, players are encouraged to lean on team synergy, social mechanics, and more intricate player guidance systems to enjoy a much more accessible entry point into the extraction shooter genre.

That mainstream appeal has brought fresh eyes into the genre, which has long been gatekept by its own intensity and inherently challenging aura.

The shift opens up the genre to players who might have bounced off Escape from Tarkov’s steep and unforgiving learning curve. It’s proof that extraction shooters don’t have to be exclusive to ‘talented’ gamers, and it also proves that you can get that dopamine hit and gambling-like gameplay loop in a game that some consider ‘easier’.

Escape from Tarkov is about to debut on Steam, hitting a 1.0 state after ten years in testing. It’s one of the biggest evolutions the game will have ever seen, and it’ll propel the title into a place of extreme popularity once again.

In the meantime, ARC Raiders will continue to soar, hold a solid community, and receive updates from Embark Studios that keep it fresh and engaging.

We can easily expect more extraction shooters to surface soon. Bungie’s Marathon is set to be released by March 2026, and there is every opportunity for top-tier titles like Call of Duty and Battlefield to dip back into the extraction market.

It might be that we see cross-genre blending become more prevalent. How about a horror-based extraction shooter or one with deeper RPG mechanics and progression paths?

There’s a lot of potential in this space, and love them or hate them, extraction shooters are here to stay.

Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you’re a fan of extraction shooters.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Nexon’s CEO has defended AI voices

We may earn affiliate commission if you purchase items through links on Insider Gaming. Read more about affiliate commission here.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/love-or-hate-extraction-shooters-wild/

item.title: Pokemon Pokopia Release Date, Trailer, Gameplay, And Everything Else We Know
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

For the better part of three decades, Pokemon's creatures have been called upon by their human trainers to do battle with each other at their command. But in 2026, the Pokemon are finally going to have their own paradise in this world in Pokemon Pokopia.

This upcoming cozy game isn't about Pokemon knocking the heck out of each other. Instead, the player can offer them the chance to live side-by-side in an environment that's been specifically tailored to their individual needs. There's no need to fight over anything, or even any need for a human to determine their destiny. Players may be guiding the actions of the Pokemon, but Pokopia will be built by a Ditto one brick at a time.

When will Pokemon Pokopia be released?

Pokemon Pokopia will be released on March 5, 2026. When the game was announced in September 2025, Pokemon Pokopia only had a vague 2026 release window. In November, Nintendo has formally announced that the game would be released just four short months later, in early March 2026.

Pokemon Pokopia Trailers

Only the announcement trailer has been released to date, but there's not really a story in this game. Instead of placing a human at the center of the gameplay, Pokopia introduces a Ditto that uses its natural transformation abilities to pass itself off as a human. This Ditto isn't hiding its true nature from the other Pokemon, but its ability to have a human body with Pokemon skills will go a long way towards the shaping the landscape.

Pokemon Pokopia Platforms

Although Pokemon Pokopia doesn't appear to be too visually taxing for either model of the Switch, it will be exclusive to Nintendo Switch 2. Players who only have the original Switch will have to upgrade before they can move into Pokopia.

Pokemon Pokopia Story, Setting and Characters

Ditto is the main character of Pokemon Pokopia, but the trailer confirms that other classic Pokemon--including Pikachu, Bulbasaur, Squirtle, and Charmander--will be drawn to Pokopia by the choices made by Ditto.

There don't appear to be any outside threats in this game. And as long as the Pokemon feel taken care of, it looks like they're going to be very happy in their new home. As for Ditto, it's unclear if its human-facing appearance can be customized by gender. But it seems like a safe bet that there will be some customization options.

Pokemon Pokopia Gameplay

The gameplay looks like a cross between Minecraft, Animal Crossing, and Dragon Quest Builders. In the trailer, Ditto demonstrates the ability to mimic the powers of other Pokemon to make grass grow or retrieve raw materials to craft objects and dwellings. Ditto can build homes for the Pokemon, transform the landscape, and even divert water to the area for a waterfall and ponds.

Ditto can also grow crops and cook food for the Pokemon, and the trailer indicates that other player characters will also be able to visit the home you've made for yourself in the game.

Pokemon Pokopia Development News

Pokemon Pokopia is being developed by Omega Force, the studio behind the Dynasty Warrior franchise, Persona 5 Strikers, and Fire Emblem Warriors. Omega Force has also had a lot of success working with Nintendo on the Legend of Zelda spin-offs Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity and Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment.

For now, it's unknown if Pokemon Pokopia will receive any post-launch DLC from Omega Force after the game's release in March 2026.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-pokopia-release-date-trailer-gameplay-and-everything-else-we-know/1100-6536133/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: BLAST R6 Major Munich Playoffs Bracket is Set—Let’s Talk Predictions
item.content:encoded:
The Swiss Stage of the massive BLAST R6 Major in Munich has just wrapped, slicing out half the competing teams and leaving us with the final eight squads fighting for the lion’s share of the $750,000 prize pool. The winner also unlocks direct qualification to the Six Invitational, so there’s plenty on the line.

Leading the charge are M80 and Team Falcons, sitting in a prime position after earning byes by topping the board in the Swiss Stage. It’s a mixed bunch that’s left, but which team is most likely to walk away with the trophy at the BLAST R6 Major in Munich? Let’s take a look at the predictions.

BLAST R6 Major Munich Predictions

The BLAST R6 Major Munich playoffs kick off in just a few hours, opening with a tense match between FaZe Clan and Wildcard. The grand final is set for November 16, and there’s a lot of ground to cover before then.

M80 and Team Falcons have proven to be something special thus far in the tournament. They’ve emerged with some aggressive map control and clean strats, pushing M80 especially into the limelight with an undefeated streak.

But will either team be able to secure the trophy this time around?

M80’s discipline might edge out any opponents coming forth, but FaZe Clan has a chance to make an upper bracket run after a tumultuous Swiss Stage. Some are hoping that Wildcard can make a break for the grand final, which, if it does, will make history as it’ll be the furthest an APAC team has got in years.

It’s a stellar run thus far for M80, relying on the old beastcoast squad that dominated the BLAST R6 Manchester Major in 2024 to lift the organization’s first trophy. Could the team pull off another huge win here in Germany?

Let me know what your BLAST R6 Major Munich predictions are on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that the Honor of Kings tournament set a Guinness World Record

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/blast-r6-major-munich-playoffs-predictions/

item.title: Trails in the Sky 2nd Chapter to launch by September 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

Platforms yet to be officially announced.

Falcom will release Trails in the Sky 2nd Chapter, a remake of The Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky SC, during the fiscal year ending September 2026, the company said in its financial report for the fiscal year ended September 2025.

Trails in the Sky 1st Chapter, a remake of The Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky, launched for PlayStation 5, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam on September 19, 2025.

Platforms for Trails in the Sky 2nd Chapter have yet to officially be announced.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/trails-in-the-sky-2nd-chapter-to-launch-by-september-2026

item.title: Ys X: Proud Nordics coming to PS5 in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Western release to include PlayStation 5 version.

Falcom will release several ported titles during the fiscal year ending September 2026, including a PlayStation 5 version of Ys X: Proud Nordics, the company said in its financial report for the fiscal year ended September 2025.

Ys X: Proud Nordics first launched for Switch 2 on July 31, 2025 in Japan, followed by both Switch 2 and PC via Steam on August 21, 2025 in Asia.

NIS America previously announced it will release both the Switch 2 and PC versions in the west in early 2026, but according to Falcom’s report, the western release will now also include the PlayStation 5 version. However, Falcom’s report does not make it clear whether the PlayStation 5 version will launch simultaneously with Switch 2 and PC.

Here is an overview of the game, via NIS America:

About

Experience Adol and Karja’s unforgettable journey across Obelia Gulf with new quality of life improvements, then discover the new story centering around Oland Island, and the mysterious newcomers Canute and Astrid. And once you’re ready, challenge yourself in the devious, time-trial dungeon of Muspelheim, where every second counts. Your new adventure awaits!

As the definitive edition of this critically acclaimed entry in the Ys series, Ys X: Proud Nordics offers all of the fast-paced combat and enthralling narrative of the original release, with new mechanics, a high-difficulty dungeon, and a brand-new storyline seamlessly integrated throughout the game.

After a tense encounter at sea, the young red-haired adventurer Adol and the proud Norman Karja find themselves bound together by shackles of Mana, and by the looming threat of an undying horde known as the Griegr, who seek to pillage the vibrant Obelia Gulf. Aboard their ship, the Sandras, Adol and Karja gather a trusty crew of friends and allies as they go head-to-head with the Griegr in one unforgettable journey!

Key Features

  • Adventure Anew – The spectacular adventure of Ys X: Nordics is back and better than ever, with improved graphical performance and quality of life updates that make this the definitive way to experience Ys X.
  • Isle of Mystery – Arrive at Oland Island and take part in a brand-new adventure! With Shield Siblings Canute and Astrid by your side, dig deep into the mystery surrounding this island in a story that’s been seamlessly integrated into the original.
  • An Ocean of Experiences Awaits – New mechanics and content abound in Ys X: Proud Nordics! Use the new Mana Hold ability to manipulate the world around you, try your hand at new challenges on Oland Island, and prepare yourself for Muspelheim, a timed dungeon of diabolical difficulty.


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/ys-x-proud-nordics-coming-to-ps5-in-2026

item.title: Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition Switch 2 Compatibility Update Released
item.content:encoded:
Previous issues have been resolved

Earlier this year, a few months after the Switch 2 launch, Nintendo identified an issue with the Switch release Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition on the new hybrid platform.

Now, according to Nintendo's new Switch 2 compatibility search page, the same title has received an update yesterday on 11th November 2025. According to the note attached, previously identified issues have been fixed.

Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition - Nintendo Switch 2 Compatibility

Supported - Game behaviour is consistent with Nintendo Switch

  • Update 11/11/2025
  • Previously identified issues have been resolved with an update

The page doesn't share any specific information, but as previously reported there was an issue where the voices were out of sync in some areas of the title. With the game behaviour now "consistent", the Definitive Edition of Xenoblade Chronicles X should work just fine on the Switch 2.

Since the new system's launch in June, Nintendo has also released an update for Xenoblade Chronicles 3, which made several adjustments to improve the overall gameplay on the new platform. There's currently been no mention of upgrades for the Xenoblade games, but there were some reports earlier this year of a supposed "hidden 60fps mode" for the Definitive Edition of X. If we hear anything, we'll be sure to let you know.

This compatibility update follows on from Nintendo's release of new firmware for the Switch 2 yesterday, bumping the system up to Version 21.0.0. You can find out more in our previous coverage here on Nintendo Life.

Have you tried out Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition on the Switch 2 yet? How are you finding it since this update? Let us know in the comments.

[source switch-software-compatibility.nintendo.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/xenoblade-chronicles-x-definitive-edition-switch-2-compatibility-update-released

item.title: Nexon CEO Defends ARC Raiders AI Voices and Says ‘Every Game Company’ is Doing It
item.content:encoded:
Unless you’ve been hiding away under a rock somewhere, you’ll likely have heard about the ongoing debate regarding ARC Raiders and Embark Studios’ use of AI to create dynamic voices in the game. It warranted one particular outlet to give the game a shockingly low score, prompting the game’s Metacritic rating to tank by a couple of points.

In a bid to defend the game, Nexon’s CEO Junghun Lee has taken to the airwaves to suggest that more developers are using AI than you realize. He directly suggested that ‘every game company’ is using AI in some capacity, and that the ‘AI voice debate’ in the ARC Raiders world is a non-starter.

Should We Ignore The AI-Generated Voices in ARC Raiders?

The presence of AI-generated voices in ARC Raiders is a point of contention for some, but for the majority, it’s not an issue. The game has managed to sell four million copies in a week and has peaked on some platforms with staggering concurrent player counts.

By numbers, ARC Raiders is the highest-rated multiplayer shooter in a decade, and the top-rated extraction shooter ever made.

But that hasn’t stopped some from lambasting the post-apocalyptic shooter on socials, striking it down for what seems to be a misunderstood use of generative AI. Embark Studios has been transparent and pointed out that voice actors provided their talents to be replicated by AI and were paid fairly for their work, but that’s not enough to placate some.

Junghun Lee, CEO of Nexon, the parent company of Embark Studios, explained in an interview:

First of all, I think it’s important to assume that every game company is now using AI. But if everyone is working with the same or similar technologies, the real question becomes: how do you survive? I believe it’s important to choose a strategy that increases your competitiveness.

AI has definitely improved efficiency in both game production and live service operations.

Using AI allows Embark Studios to bring this game to the market and float it with updates that are delivered faster and more cost-effectively. The team also uses machine learning algorithms to encourage dynamic animations of the game’s ARC enemies, but it’s the AI voices that most people have issues with, as it walks a blurry line that many are reluctant to accept as becoming the de facto standard.

Do you think there’s anything to be concerned about regarding Embark Studios’ reliance on AI for voice lines? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Epic is changing Fortnite’s revival system

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/arc-raiders-nexon-ceo-defends-ai-voices/

item.title: 3D Pixel Wuxia RPG 'Wandering Sword' Announced For Switch 2 And Switch
item.content:encoded:
Master the martial arts in 2026

If you're eager for even more RPG action on the Switch and Switch 2, Clouded Leopard and Spiral Up have today announced the release of Wandering Sword in 2026.

This is a martial-arts style role-playing game set in a wuxia world that blends "traditional pixel art graphics" with "immersive 3D landscapes". It features an "innovative combat system" operating on a tiled board, and allows you to swap between turn-based and real-time battles on the fly.

It's also got a vast library of martial arts moves and weapons, and you can build relationships with NPC and recruit new martial artists. To top it off are multiple endings, offering a high level of replayability.

If you're not already convinced, the PC version of this game is highly rated - with "overwhelmingly positive" user reviews on Steam. It's also received some glowing reviews from critics. Here's additional PR, which notes how the upcoming console versions will include two major DLC content packs and new voice overs. (via Gematsu):

Originally developed by Shanghai-based indie studio The Swordman Studio, Wandering Sword is a 3D pixel wuxia RPG published by Singapore-based Spiral Up Games.

The game was first released for Steam in September 2023, where it has since received over 31,000 reviews and earned an “Overwhelmingly Positive” rating (94 percent positive), making it one of the most acclaimed indie titles of recent years.

The upcoming PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch 2, and Nintendo Switch versions published by Clouded Leopard Entertainment will include two major downloadable content packs previously released on Steam: “Mount Pack: The Supreme Steed” and “Immortal Trails Across the Blue Sea.”

In addition, these versions will feature newly recorded Japanese and Chinese voice=overs, as well as Japanese and Korean subtitles, allowing players to experience the sweeping Eastern epic in even greater depth.

Voice cast details will be announced at a later date—please stay tuned for future updates!

About

The story begins with a young swordsman gravely injured after being caught in a violent conflict. Having narrowly escaped death, you embark on a journey to master the martial arts and fulfill your destiny as a true hero in a vast, living wuxia world.

An Epic Story with 20 Endings – Your choices will dramatically alter the course of the story, which branches into 20 different endings. Dozens of side quests add further depth and replayability.

Dual Battle Modes – Battle strategically or act in real time—switch freely between turn-based command combat and real- time action on a tactical, tile-based battlefield. Master a variety of weapons and martial arts schools to become a true kung fu master!

Beautiful Pixel Art – Experience the breathtaking depiction of ancient China, brought to life through stunning, hand-crafted pixel art rarely seen in modern gaming.

When we hear more about the Switch and Switch 2 release of Wandering Sword, we'll let you know.

[source gematsu.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/3d-pixel-wuxia-rpg-wandering-sword-announced-for-switch-2-and-switch

item.title: Famitsu Review Scores: Issue 1923
Ubisoft Is Working On A New Multiplayer Shooter
item.content:encoded:
According to several gaming insiders, Ubisoft is currently working on a new multiplayer shooter. Furthermore, some concept art and even an in-progress screenshot of the game have been shown.

Ubisoft has had a fair share of shooters over the past 40 years. From the iconic Tom Clancy series to the wild Far Cry franchise, it’s served up quite a few good ones. Still, the company has only managed one success in the multiplayer FPS world: Rainbow Six Siege. With many companies like PlayStation/Bungie and EA getting in on the trend, a supposed leak teases that Ubisoft wants in. Now, we may know what that vision the team is shooting for may look like, and it’s literally out of this world.

Project Scout, An FPS Sci-Fi Competitive Shooter from Ubisoft, Possibly Leaked

Twitter/X leaker Shiny posted a message surrounding a new multiplayer title from Ubisoft. The FPS, supposedly made in Unreal Engine 5, takes place in a sci-fi world. It would include competitive multiplayer, including crossplay, and be on a larger scale than other titles.

Later on, user 6leaks furthered Shiny’s claim, posting screenshots of the title, known as Project Scout. The images, seen above, show what appears to be a loading screen with concept art and an in-game screenshot with developing assets and the game’s UI. We can also see one of the characters on the bottom left, as well as some interesting interface systems like a compass and ‘crew level’.

It’s important to note that Ubisoft has not confirmed Project Scout or any new multiplayer game, so take the news with a grain of salt. We have reached out to Ubisoft to confirm and will update if and when we get a response. Regardless, the concept does look pretty cool, and it’ll be interesting to see, if true, how the core gameplay will work.

What do you think of Ubisoft’s Project Scout? Do you think it’s real? Do you want it to be? Think it can make another multiplayer shooter and succeed? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Ubisoft, check out our articles on the supposed Assassin’s Creed Black Flag remake and Splinter Cell reboot. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/ubisoft-multiplayer-shooter-project-scout-rumor-2025/

item.title: Sony Interactive Entertainment announces 27-inch gaming monitor with DualSense charging hook
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5

Due out in 2026 in the United States and Japan.

Sony Interactive Entertainment has announced a 27-inch gaming monitor with a DualSense charging hook. It will launch in the United States and Japan in 2026. Pricing was not announced.

Here are the first details, via Sony Interactive Entertainment vice president of product management Shuzo Kikuchi:

Since the launch of the PlayStation 5 console, we’ve seen that players enjoy having the flexibility to choose where they play PlayStation 5 games—whether it’s in their living room on their big screen TV, in other areas of the home, or outside of the home remotely with PlayStation Portal remote player. In keeping up with these trends, we are pleased to introduce another option for players with our new 27-inch Gaming Monitor with DualSense Charging Hook—coming to the United States and Japan.

The new PlayStation gaming monitor pairs nicely with our recently announced Pulse Elevate wireless speakers, which features lifelike desktop audio and seamless voice chat. Both products were designed with the PlayStation 5 desktop gaming experience in mind, offering a high-quality visual and audio desktop experience for those who want the option of playing in personal spaces.

Developed by Sony Interactive Entertainment, the new 27-inch Gaming Monitor delivers stunning visuals from the latest PlayStation 5 games to your desktop, featuring:

  • A Quad High Definition (QHD) IPS display up to 2560 x 1440 resolution, so players can game at a comfortable viewing distance from their desk.
  • High Dynamic Range support with Auto HDR Tone Mapping that automatically adjusts HDR settings during setup on PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 5 Pro consoles, ensuring rich and vivid picture quality.
  • VRR support and refresh rates of up to 120 hertz for smooth and seamless gameplay on PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 5 Pro consoles, and 240 hertz on compatible PC and Mac devices.
  • A built-in Charging Hook for a DualSense or DualSense Edge wireless controller (sold separately) that makes it easy for players to get right into gaming.

The new PlayStation gaming monitor supports VESA mounting and also has a full suite of audio and connectivity options, including USB ports for your PlayStation Link adapter:

  • Two HDMI IN port (ver 2.1) and one DisplayPort IN port (ver 1.4) for compatibility with PlayStation 5, PC, Mac, or other devices.
    • HDMI IN port (ver 2.1) supports up to 2560×1440, 240 hertz, FRL, VRR; DisplayPort IN port (ver 1.4) supports up to 2560×1440, 240 hertz, DSC.
  • Two USB Type-A and one USB Type-C port that can be used with PlayStation Link Adapters or other devices.
  • Built-in stereo speaker and 3.5mm audio output.
  • Compatibility with select VESA mounting systems for a more flexible display setup.

Watch a teaser trailer below.

Teaser Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/sony-interactive-entertainment-announces-27-inch-gaming-monitor-with-dualsense-charging-hook

item.title: Dynasty Warriors: Origins' Major DLC Hits The Battlefield The Same Day As Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
Get ready for an even bigger launch

During PlayStation's 'State of Play' broadcast this week, Koei Tecmo and Omega Force issued a reminder about the "major DLC" on the way to the 1 vs. 1,000 musuo early next year.

The Visions of the Four Heroes will add new stories and weapons when it arrives on 22nd January 2026 for $34.99 (or your regional equivalent) and pre-orders are now live on select platforms. This date lines up with the base game's launch on the Switch 2.

Here's some additional details, and you can check out the latest overview trailer above.

"Visions of Four Heroes features brand-new stories centered around four heroes whose stories were not explored in DYNASTY WARRIORS: ORIGINS: Zhang Jiao, Dong Zhuo, Yuan Shao and Lu Bu. These stories are explored as “What If” scenarios and will allow players to discover new sides to these legendary heroes. New companions are also featured in the major DLC including Zhuhe, a Guardian of Peace; Diaochan, a beautiful warrior and a familiar fan favorite; and a mysterious new officer who will be revealed as the story unfolds.

"Fans will also be able to enjoy new weapons – the “Bow” and “Rope Dart” – to further enhance the exhilarating action of 1 vs. 1,000 warfare by leveraging each weapon’s unique characteristics on the battlefield. Existing weapons will also receive an update, granting new arts, skill panels, as well as an increase in the trait level cap. Finally, a new “Training Ground” mode will be included, where players battle formidable foes while practicing their skills."

And if you pre-order the DLC, for a "limited time" you will also receive an exclusive outfit for the protagonist (the "Yellow Turban Attire"). Below is some more information about this. There'll also be an early purchase bonus and a digital pre-order bonus for Switch 2 players.

"Designed to embody the heroic spirit of DYNASTY WARRIORS: ORIGINS, this costume lets players take to the battlefield clad in the symbolic garb of the Yellow Turban Rebellion."

Will you be getting this game when it launches for Switch 2? What do you think about the upcoming DLC? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/dynasty-warriors-origins-major-dlc-hits-the-battlefield-the-same-day-as-switch-2

item.title: Artdink announces ARTDINK GAME LOG catalog title ports for Switch, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • Switch

Tail of the Sun and Aquanaut's Holiday start off the lineup.

Artdink has announced ARTDINK GAME LOG, a project to port and re-release games  previously developed by Artdink onto modern hardware. The first title, Tail of the Sun, will launch for Switch and PC via Steam on December 16 in Japan. The second title, Aquanaut’s Holiday, will follow for the same platforms in 2026. A third title will be revealed at a later date.

Here is an overview of Tail of the Sun, via its Steam page:

About

The “Weird Game of the Century” released on PlayStation returns! Tail of the Sun is a simple 3D action game where you control a caveman living a wild life. Wagashi-shaped nuts, An open-world field, and avant-garde techno music… Experience a wild, pure, and simple life.

Hone Your Beastly Skills! Primitive Life 3D Action

Tail of the Sun is a simple 3D action game where you control a primitive human as their guardian spirit, living a wild life.

Released for the PlayStation in 1994, its unique worldview earned it the reputation as a “once-in-a-century oddball game.”

The protagonist of this game is a primitive human. Their daily life was driven purely by instinct.

They slept when tired, gathered fallen nuts, hunted animals to satisfy their hunger.

This game recreates that wild, simple existence.

Wagashi-shaped nuts, an open-world field, scattered objects resembling human body parts, avant-garde techno music, and a caveman who suddenly falls asleep while head-sliding…

Experience a wild, pure, and simple life that appeals to your primal instincts.

Pile Up Ivory and Grab the Sun’s Tail!

The goal is to build a tower reaching the sun by stacking “ivory” obtained from hunting mammoths.

Primitive humans have weak legs and little strength, making even hunting small prey a struggle.

However, by eating nuts scattered across the field and the meat of hunted animals, they gradually grow stronger.

With this strengthened body, take down even stronger prey and develop your settlement.

Your strength will be passed down to the next generation of primitive people.

Someday, with a resilient body and weapons, you will be able to defeat your arch-enemy, the mammoth.

What will happen when the ivory tower reaches the sun?

Witness the next form of evolution.

ARTDINK GAME LOG Series

ARTDINK GAME LOG is a project to port and re-release game titles previously developed by Artdink onto modern gaming hardware.

It serves as a record (log) of Artdink’s game development journey. By reviving past masterpieces using current technology and platforms, it delivers nostalgia and rediscovery to longtime fans, while offering an unprecedented experience to new players.

Watch the opening movie below.

Opening Movie



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/artdink-announces-artdink-game-log-catalog-title-ports-for-switch-pc

item.title: Octopath Traveler 0 Demo Now Available For Switch And Switch 2, Save Data Carries Over
item.content:encoded:
Get a head start!

Alongside a new story trailer today, Square Enix has released an eShop demo for its upcoming Switch and Switch 2 release, Octopath Traveler 0.

This demo will allow you to experience the opening of the new game, including the first chapter of three different story arcs from the "Retribution story, as well as the first chapter of the "Restoration story" (or up to three hours of gameplay).

Save data will also carry across to the full release when it arrives next month on 4th December 2025.

Here's some extra information about what you can expect in the demo:

The first thing you’ll do is design your protagonist, and play through the explosive introduction to the game. You’ll discover how a joyful town festival turns to tragedy, and how your hero embarks on a journey of restoration and revenge.

You’ll set off after three antagonists, known as the Masters. Each of them has their own ‘Master of’ arc, and in the demo, you can play through the first chapter of each of them in any order you please.

You can also play up to the end of the first chapter of the ‘Kindlers of the Flame’ story arc, which focuses on the restoration of Wishvale and the town-building features of the game. It’s a great way to lay some strong foundations before you build the town of your dreams in the full game!

You can play through all this content for up to three hours. After that, the demo ends.

Will you be checking out this demo? Let us know in the comments.

[source square-enix-games.com]

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply


https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/octopath-traveler-0-demo-now-available-for-switch-and-switch-2-save-data-carries-over

item.title: LET IT DIE: INFERNO G-STAR 2025 trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

New story trailer ahead of release.

Publisher GungHo Online Entertainment and developer Supertrick Games have released the G-STAR 2025 trailer for LET IT DIE: INFERNO.

The roguelite survival action game will be playable at the Busan, South Korea exhibition from November 13 to 16, where GungHo Online Entertainment will also be giving away t-shirts, badges, and stickers.

Here is an overview of the game, via GungHo Online Entertainment:

LET IT DIE: INFERNO is a roguelite survival action game where you can engage in chaotic battles with grotesque monsters, enemy factions, and even other players.

Humanity had just recovered from the unprecedented cataclysm known as “Earth Rage,” when suddenly, a massive chasm appeared—large enough to swallow an entire city whole.​ Someone began calling the hole “Hell Gate,” and lying at its depths is the “Eye of the Reaper,” a powerful crystal containing the energy to rule the world. Explore, survive, and extract from the Inferno, where stage layouts and item placements differ every match.

​In this game, on top of PvEvP—where players and enemies collide within Hell Gate—there is also a mode for battling exclusively with other players. We hope you enjoy this powered-up version of the LET IT DIE world!

LET IT DIE: INFERNO is due out for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam on December 3.

Watch the trailer below.

G-STAR 2025 Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/let-it-die-inferno-g-star-2025-trailer

item.title: RUSHING BEAT X: Return of Brawl Brothers launches March 19, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Switch 2 version ships on a full game card in Japan.

RUSHING BEAT X: Return of Brawl Brothers will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam on March 19, 2026, publishers City Connection and Clear River Games announced.

In Japan, physical editions will be available 5,980 yen on PlayStation 5 and 6,980 yen on Switch 2. The Switch 2 version will ship on a game card (not a game-key card).

A limited edition will also be available for 7,980 yen on PlayStation 5 and 8,980 yen on Switch 2, which includes a SteelBook case, “RUSHING BEAT X Super Secret Encyclopedia” with a music CD, and a limited edition box.

Here is an overview of the game, via City Connection:

About

Neo-Cisco has been shaken by organized crime, a deadly virus and more, and each time justice and right have prevailed thanks to a small band of brave fighters. Now, they must rise up again to face an overwhelming evil and discover the true mastermind behind these past events.

Jaleco’s Rushing Beat returns, bringing a beat ’em up cocktail with new moves, new weapons, and new allies, and an exciting, two-player co-op story for double the impact!

Action

With easy-to-use auto-combos, even beginners can enjoy exhilarating action. Chain together your own combos with various actions like counterattacks, follow-up strikes, and weapon-based attacks. Most actions can be canceled with dashes or jumps. Master the cancel system and unleash even more consecutive attacks!

Throw techniques can be varied with key inputs. Send your targeted enemies flying, and if you throw them into the background, you can destroy normally unreachable objects, giving you a chance to acquire items!

As you land hits or take damage, your rage gauge increases. When the gauge reaches MAX, you enter rage mode. In addition to enhanced attack and defense abilities, you’ll also be able to unleash a finishing move called “Beat Rush.” Overcome evil with the power of righteous fury!

Chapters

Battle across varied locales: in shopping malls, slums, subways, and research facilities as you fight to uncover the truth and save the city once more! Challenge side-missions along the way, with challenges involving various actions and stage gimmicks!

Characters

With multiple characters, from series veterans Rick Norton and Douglas Bild and newcomers too, mastering the unique fighting style of each fighter is the key to success, with more unlocking more as you progress through the game. Two-player co-op adds a further layer of strategy, and fun: mix and match characters and find the perfect team!

Food

At the Tuff E Nuff, kitchen car, which also serves as a checkpoint in stages, you can combine the various food items you have. Creating combo meals with three types of food increases healing potential and may also grant special effects! Whether attacking or eating, combos are the way to go!

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/rushing-beat-x-return-of-brawl-brothers-launches-march-19-2026

item.title: This 50-Inch 4K Fire TV Suddenly Drops 40% Off, Amazon Clears Stock for Pocket Change
item.content:encoded:
The 50-inch size hits the sweet spot for most living rooms and bedrooms, large enough for an immersive viewing experience without overwhelming your space. This Insignia F50 Series 4K Fire TV just dropped to an all-time low of $179 on Amazon, down from its regular $299 price. For this price, you’ll get a smart TV equipped with Ultra HD resolution, HDR10 support and built-in Fire TV streaming without the premium pricing that Samsung or LG demand for similar specs.

See at Amazon

4K Resolution That Makes a Difference

The 3840×2160 resolution supplies four times the pixel density of standard 1080p displays which becomes evident when watching nature documentaries or sports where fine details make all the difference. Textures in clothes are finer, individual blades of grass on football fields are more distinguishable, and facial features during close-ups are sharper. The upscaling engine takes your existing HD content from cable boxes or Blu-ray players and upscales it to near-4K quality, filling in missing information via intelligent processing. This means that even older shows and movies look better than they did on your previous TV.

HDR10 opens up a wider color gamut than what standard dynamic range displays can show, and displays subtle gradations in bright skies and shadow details that might otherwise disappear to black. Sunsets contain more layers of orange and red rather than a flat blob of color, and dark movie scenes reveal details in shadows without washing out the overall image. This wider color gamut makes animated films pop with vibrant hues while live-action content receives a more realistic appearance that feels closer to what your eyes see in real life.

The Fire TV interface puts streaming apps front and center and removes the need for external streaming sticks or boxes that clutter your entertainment center. Netflix, Prime Video, Disney+, Hulu, and HBO Max load directly from the home screen, and the system remembers where you left off across different services. Voice control through the included Alexa remote lets you search for content by speaking actor names, movie titles, or even vague descriptions.

DTS Virtual-X processing does give simulated surround sound from the TV’s built-in speakers, and furthers dialogue clarity and adding spatial depth to action sequences. It analyzes the audio signal and adjusts the output of the speakers to create an impression of height and width that goes beyond the physical speaker placements. Of course, it is not a replacement for a dedicated sound system, but it considerably enhances the viewing experience compared to the thin, tinny audio that plagues budget TVs.

HDMI eARC support transmits full-resolution audio from streaming apps or connected devices to compatible soundbars and receivers without compression. This type of connection is used to handle more advanced audio formats like Dolby Atmos and DTS:X which need higher bandwidth than the standard HDMI ARC allows. You can attach a soundbar later with no concerns about limitations of audio quality and the automatic switching of the audio output when connecting compatible equipment occurs seamlessly.

The refresh rate of 60Hz handles standard TV content and movies smoothly, and refreshed the image 60 times per second so that motion blur does not occur when the camera pans or there is fast action on screen. Smart home integration allows Ring doorbell feeds, Philips Hue lights, or Nest thermostats to be accessed through the TV interface using voice commands. Content from iPhones and iPads can directly mirror onto the screen via Apple AirPlay, without the use of additional casting devices.

But this Insignia TV delivers on most people’s actual usage at a price point of just $179 for a 50-inch 4K display with streaming built in, rather than requiring months of budgeting.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/this-50-inch-4k-fire-tv-suddenly-drops-40-off-amazon-clears-stock-for-pocket-change-2000643083

item.title: Kyouran Makaism second trailer
Once Upon a KATAMARI DLC packs ‘Katamari Damacy Series Dance Dance Remixes’ and ‘Katamari Damacy Series Neo Remixes’ announced
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Due out in November and this winter, respectively.

Publisher Bandai Namco and developer RENGAME have announced Once Upon a KATAMARI downloadable content packs “Katamari Damacy Series Dance Dance Remixes” and “Katamari Damacy Series Neo Remixes.”

“Katamari Damacy Series Dance Dance Remixes” will launch in November, followed by “Katamari Damacy Series Neo Remixes” this winter. Each pack includes five new remix tracks and ten accessories.

With each downloadable content release, users will also receive a special set of accessories via a free update.

Once Upon a KATAMARI is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/once-upon-a-katamari-dlc-packs-katamari-damacy-series-dance-dance-remixes-and-katamari-damacy-series-neo-remixes-announced

item.title: Gran Turismo 7 PS5 DLC ‘Power Pack’ announced
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Due out on December 4.

Publisher Sony Interactive Entertainment and developer Polyphony Digital have announced Gran Turismo 7 paid downloadable content “Power Pack.” It will launch exclusively for the PlayStation 5 version on December 4.

Here is an overview of the downloadable content, via Polyphony Digital:

About the Downloadable Content “Power Pack”

  • Fifty new races across six distinctive themes, featuring intense 24-hour endurance events
  • Experience a full race season, that includes practice and qualifying and the main event
  • Engage in close-quarters battles with Gran Turismo Sophy 3.0
  •  Includes 5,000,000 In-game Credits to jumpstart your racing journey

The “Power Pack” is a brand-new game mode that captures the true spirit of motorsports. It features 50 all-new races spread across six themes inspired by countries and car culture around the world. Take on grueling 24-hour endurance challenges, experience a full race season that includes practice to qualifying to the main event, and go wheel-to-wheel in heart-pounding, tail-to-nose battles against Gran Turismo Sophy 3.0, the latest evolution of our advanced AI racer—available exclusively in the “Power Pack.”

Get ready for pure, high-octane excitement. Sharpen your skills through relentless competition and feel the satisfaction that only true racing can deliver.

The “Power Pack” also includes 5,000,000 in-game Credits.

This is a new chapter in Gran Turismo—one that redefines what racing means. Stay tuned for more details.

  • Your “Power Pack” journey begins from the sailboat on the World Map.
  • Europe, Historic Cars, Nurburgring, and more—50 events across six themes celebrating countries and automotive culture.
  • Start with getting a feel for the car and track. Practice in real time just like a real race driver.
  • You can also use Practice to size up your rivals and perfect your lines before moving on to ‘Qualifying and the Race in full-session play.

Take On Races Based On Real Life Events

  • Group C Memories
  • Nurburgring Group 3
  • Civic Race ’90s
  • Japan GT500 ’90s

Gran Turismo 7 is available now for PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/gran-turismo-7-ps5-dlc-power-pack-announced

item.title: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds New Free Characters Update, Coming Soon
item.content:encoded:
And SpongeBob joins the race later this month

Ahead of Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds release on the Switch 2, Sega has revealed more free characters are "coming soon".

This includes the previously confirmed character NiGHTS in December 2025, Super Monkey Ball's AiAi in January 2026, and last but not least, the Sonic the Hedgehog IDW duo, Tangle and Whisper, who are arriving in February 2026.

The next paid DLC (including SpongeBob and Patrick, a new course, and much more) will also be released later this month on 19th November 2025. Sega also mentions how there are even more exciting racers to be added in the future.

And once again, Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds for the Switch 2 launches on 4th December 2025. This includes an upgrade pack for existing Switch owners, which is currently 50% off ($5 instead of $10, or your regional equivalent).

In some other Sonic news, the Blue Blur this week joins Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac as part of a paid DLC collaboration set. Pac-Man will also be joining Sonic's new racing game in the future.

What do you think of these free characters? Let us know in the comments.

Liam is a news writer and reviewer across Hookshot Media. He's been writing about games for more than 15 years and is a lifelong fan of many iconic video game characters.

  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: PlayStation Is Releasing Its Own PC Gaming Monitor
item.content:encoded:
PlayStation is entering the gaming monitor market with its very own PC monitor.

Announced at the end of Tuesday’s State of Play Japan showcase, the PlayStation Gaming Monitor is the first of its kind under the PlayStation brand. It’s also designed for use with both the PlayStation 5 (PS5) and PC.

What Are The Gaming Monitor’s Features?

The PlayStation gaming monitor—not to be confused with Sony’s INZONE brand—comes in at 27″ with a Quad High Definition (QHD) IPS display at a max 2K (2560 x 1440p) resolution. It also includes High Dynamic Range (HDR) support with Auto HDR Tone Mapping. For refresh rates, the monitor supports up to 240 Hz on PC and 120 Hz on PS5 and PS5 Pro consoles as well as Variable Refresh Rates (VRR).

One of the more unique features is the built-in charging hook for DualSense and DualSense Edge controllers.

Input wise, it has two HDMI 2.1 inputs and one DisplayPort 1.4 input. There are also two USB-A ports and one USB-C port. Lastly, the monitor has a built-in speaker and 3.5mm audio output while also being VESA compatible for mounting.

The PlayStation gaming monitor will launch sometime in 2026 though no sepecific date or price was confirmed. What was announced, however, was that it will only be available in the United States and Japan.

Are you going to pick up the PlayStation gaming monitor whenever it releases?

For more Insider Gaming, read about Reggie Fils-Aimé’s thoughts on the lack of first party Xbox games on the Nintendo Switch 2. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Super Robot Wars Y ‘DLC #1: Contract from the Darkness’ launches November 20
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch

Version 1.1.0 update due out on November 17.

The Super Robot Wars Y version 1.1.0 update will launch on November 17, followed by the paid “Downloadable Content #1: Contract from the Darkness” on November 20, publisher Bandai Namco and developer Bandai Namco Forge Digitals announced. Early access for the downloadable content will begin on November 18.

Here is an overview of the new content:

  • Version 1.1.0 Update
    • Special Mission: “Battle Rush” added
    • EX Level Pilot Skills added
    • Downloadable Content #1 Mission #1:” A Smile on the Street Corner”
    • Other stability improvements
  • “Downloadable Content #1: Contract from the Darkness”
    • Five new playable units
    • 16 new Area Missions
    • 13 new Onboard Missions
    • Two new Assist Crew members
    • Featured series:
      • Galaxy Cyclone Braiger
      • The Big O
      • Fuuto PI: The Portrait of Kamen Rider Skull

Super Robot Wars Y is available now for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Wandering Sword coming to PS5 on May 28, 2026, Switch 2 and Switch in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

Pre-orders now available.

Publishers Clouded Leopard Entertainment and Spiral Up Games, and developer The Swordman Studio will release 3D pixel Wuxia RPG Wandering Sword for PlayStation 5 on May 28, 2026, followed by Switch 2 and Switch later in 2026, the companies announced.

The game will be available digitally worldwide, as well both physically in Japan and Asia. Pre-orders for the digital edition are available now via PlayStation Store for $34.99 / £29.99 / €34.99 / ¥4,928. A Deluxe Edition will also be available for $44.99 / £39.99 / €44.99 / ¥6,578, which includes an accessory set and the digital soundtrack. Pre-orders for either version include 72 hours of early access and two original costumes.

Wandering Sword first launched for PC via Steam on September 15, 2023.

Here is an overview of the game, via Clouded Leopard Entertainment:

Console Versions

Originally developed by Shanghai-based indie studio The Swordman Studio, Wandering Sword is a 3D pixel wuxia RPG published by Singapore-based Spiral Up Games.

The game was first released for Steam in September 2023, where it has since received over 31,000 reviews and earned an “Overwhelmingly Positive” rating (94 percent positive), making it one of the most acclaimed indie titles of recent years.

The upcoming PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch 2, and Nintendo Switch versions published by Clouded Leopard Entertainment will include two major downloadable content packs previously released on Steam: “Mount Pack: The Supreme Steed” and “Immortal Trails Across the Blue Sea.”

In addition, these versions will feature newly recorded Japanese and Chinese voice=overs, as well as Japanese and Korean subtitles, allowing players to experience the sweeping Eastern epic in even greater depth.

Voice cast details will be announced at a later date—please stay tuned for future updates!

About

The story begins with a young swordsman gravely injured after being caught in a violent conflict. Having narrowly escaped death, you embark on a journey to master the martial arts and fulfill your destiny as a true hero in a vast, living wuxia world.

  • An Epic Story with 20 Endings – Your choices will dramatically alter the course of the story, which branches into 20 different endings. Dozens of side quests add further depth and replayability.
  • Dual Battle Modes – Battle strategically or act in real time—switch freely between turn-based command combat and real- time action on a tactical, tile-based battlefield. Master a variety of weapons and martial arts schools to become a true kung fu master!
  • Beautiful Pixel Art – Experience the breathtaking depiction of ancient China, brought to life through stunning, hand-crafted pixel art rarely seen in modern gaming.


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/wandering-sword-coming-to-ps5-on-may-28-2026-switch-2-and-switch-in-2026
